summary: Phage display technology has been applied to the directed evolution of enzymes, allowing for the creation and selection of variants with improved properties. This method involves inserting nucleotide sequences encoding enzyme mutants into phage coat proteins, enabling the display of these enzymes on the phage surface.
key_claims: Phage display technology is used for the directed evolution of enzymes by creating libraries of mutant enzymes.
The most widespread vectors are filamentous bacteriophages fd, M13, or related phagemids.
